ygData.subject: Re: Bandits
ygData.msgSnippet: *smiles* aye now to explain it to the crew... *giggles* Azlana
ygData.messageBody:
*smiles* aye now to explain it to the crew... *giggles*

Azlana

James Schuldes wrote:

> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> When your group gets into a fight with multiple opponents - some who con
> higher than you'd normally try solo - you need to concentrate your fire
> power. Your party needs to all gang up on a selected bad guy and kill him
> first. The trouble is coordinating - especially when they move around and
> have the same names. You cant tell by looking which "a bandit" is the one
> you have targeted and which one the tank has selected. Especially after the
> first one is killed and the tank selects the next one.
>
> So, what you do is target your tank like you are gonna issue an invite and
> then use the /assist command. That will automatically change your target to
> the same target the tank has selected. Now attack and you are assured that
> you and the tank are hitting the same target.
>
> Make sense?
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: suzkim@... [mailto:suzkim@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 7:39 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Bandits
>
> From: suzkim@...
>
> Thanks,
>
> Assist? never heard so therefore never used it... I get the
> jist that it will
> help the tank out but could you explain futher?
>
> Thanks,
>
> Az
>
> James Schuldes wrote:
>
> > From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
> >
> > In west karanas, there are usually 2 at the bottom of the
> hill where they
> > camp (north side of the zone.) Sometimes one will be a
> spellcaster. We
> > gang up to nail those. If we go after the whole camp, we
> have one or two
> > groups and gang them.
> >
> > There are 2 schools of thought:
> >
> > Kill the weakest one first to reduce the numbers.
> >
> > Kill the strongest one first to reduce their power.
> >
> > In any case, you want to use good group tactics. Select a
> "tank" and all of
> > the party target the tank. Have the tank engage the
> bandit first and let
> > him get some hits in. Then use /assist command to make
> sure everyone
> > concentrates on the same target the tank has selected.
> When you have a
> > group fighting another group, the /assist command is very
> helpful to insure
> > that you all are selecting the same target and
> concentrating your powers.
> >
> > Snyak.
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: suzkim@...
> [mailto:suzkim@...]
> > Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 6:23 AM
> > To: Warrior Mailing
> > Subject: [warriors_eq] Bandits
> >
> > From: suzkim@...
> >
> > Greetings,
> >
> > Well finally made 15. So, figured let me
> try bandits. .
> > Hummm. Didn't
> > know any better and got a lil too close
> and ended up with 3
> > or 4 of them
> > on my butt an died.. back to 14.
> >
> > Any tips or tricks on hunting these?
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Azlana
> > Barbarian Warrior of Veeshan with a very
> bruised ego
> >
> >
> >
